page.title: 10THE LOCAL NEWSPAPER
page.content: The weekly "Abergele Visitor" is one of 9 newspapers published on the coast by the N.Wales Weekly News newspaper group on its computerised photo-setting machines at Llandudno Junction. It was established independently in the early 1860's and is so named because originally its principle news comprised lists of holidaymakers staying in Abergele and Pensarn. It retails at 12p and has a weekly circulation of 6,500 copies covering Rhyl to Llanddulas. It is staffed by an editor (Tony Moores) an assistant editor, 2 reporters and a free-lance photographer. Production day is Thursday, for sale on Friday. Stories this week concern disquiet over aspects of the building developments up Llanfair Road; the raising of Â£1/4 million for the local general hospital's body-scanner fund.
